title: Simplify
text: First, we need to use the Distributive Property to get rid of the parentheses, and then combine like terms.
speech: First, we need to use the Distributive Property to get rid of the parentheses, and then combine like terms.

title: Simplified Inequality
speech: The simplified inequality is  15 x plus 21, is greater than, 10 x minus 24 .
pacedSpeech: The simplified inequality is   15 x plus 21, is greater than, 10 x minus 24

title: Isolate
text: We want to isolate the variable on one side of the inequality.
speech: We want to isolate the variable on one side of the inequality.
pacedSpeech: We want to isolate the variable on one side of the inequality.

title: Subtraction Property of Inequality
text: To isolate the variable, we can subtract $$10x$$ and $$21$$ from both sides of the inequality. This gives us $$15x+21-10x-21>10x-24-10x-21$$.
speech: To isolate the variable, we can subtract  10 x  and  21  from both sides of the inequality. This gives us  15 x plus 21 minus 10 x minus 21 is greater than 10 x minus 24 minus 10 x minus 21 .

title: Simplify
speech: Simplifying the inequality gives us , 5 x is greater than negative 45 .

title: Division Property of Inequality
text: Then, we can divide both sides of the inequality by $$5$$, which gives us $$x$$ on the left hand side and $$-9$$ on the right hand side.
speech: Then, we can divide both sides of the inequality by , 5 , which gives us  x  on the left hand side and  negative 9  on the right hand side.

title: Inequality Sign
text: Since we divided by a postive number, the inequality stays the same. Hence, we have $$x>-9$$.
speech: Since we divided by a postive number, the inequality stays the same. Hence, we have , x is greater than negative 9, .

title: Interval Notation: Parentheses and Brackets
text: In interval notation, parentheses show that the endpoint of the inequality is not included. For example, the expression "x>3" includes all numbers greater than $$3$$. Since $$3$$ is not included in the solution, the interval notation is $$(3,\infty)$$. Since $$\infty$$ represents "infinity" and is not an actual number, we always put a parenthesis next to $$\infty$$.
speech: In interval notation, parentheses show that the endpoint of the inequality is not included. For example, the expression "x>3" includes all numbers greater than  3 . Since  3  is not included in the solution, the interval notation is , the open interval from 3 to infinity, . Since  infinity  represents "infinity" and is not an actual number, we always put a parenthesis next to  infinity .
